title: Nissan Audit Chief Sought to Expand Ghosn Probe—and Was Shut Down
text:
Nissan Motor Co.’s audit chief made a list of Nissan employees she believed enabled alleged wrongdoing by former Chairman Carlos Ghosn and planned to create a committee to consider disciplining them, but Nissan quashed her plan after a leading target said it wasn’t necessary, according to an internal email and people familiar with the decision.

The audit chief, Christina Murray, who left Nissan in September, said in the email that she cautioned a top executive about following the advice of a person suspected of wrongdoing...
description: Nissan’s former audit chief listed some 80 employees suspected of enabling alleged wrongdoing by former Chairman Carlos Ghosn and wanted to pursue disciplinary measures, but her effort was quashed, people familiar with the matter said.
